description: The Bachelor of Science in Aeronautics and Astronautics is designed to provide students with a foundation in the fundamental disciplines of aerospace engineering, as well as the opportunity to pursue advanced coursework and research in areas such as aerodynamics, structures, dynamics and control, and propulsion. The program prepares students for careers in the aerospace industry, government, and research institutions, as well as for graduate study.
name: Aeronautics and Astronautics (B.S.)

description: The Department of African and African American Studies offers an undergraduate major in Africana/Afro-American Studies (AFRAM) leading to the Bachelor of Arts degree. The program is designed to allow students to develop a broad understanding of the experiences, cultures, and histories of black peoples throughout Africa and its Diaspora. Students acquire a historical and contemporary understanding of the diverse experiences of black peoples and the contributions of black peoples to world civilization. Students engage with a variety of materials including history, literature, culture, and social science.
name: African and African American Studies (B.A.)

description: The Department of American Studies offers an undergraduate major in American Studies leading to a Bachelor of Arts degree. The program is designed to introduce students to the interdisciplinary study of the United States, drawing on a range of methodologies and fields in the humanities and social sciences. Students explore topics such as culture, history, literature, politics, and identity.
name: American Studies (B.A.)

description: The Department of Anthropology offers a program of study leading to the Bachelor of Arts degree. The major is designed to introduce students to the broad and diverse field of anthropology, provide training in the basic methods and theory of the discipline, and allow students to pursue particular interests in human societies, cultures, and biological variation. Courses for the major are divided into three main categories: Archaeology and biological anthropology; Sociocultural anthropology; and Anthropological theory and methods. Students work with their advisers to design a coherent program of study that meets their individual interests and needs.
name: Anthropology (B.A.)

description: The Department of Anthropology offers a program of study leading to the Bachelor of Arts degree in Archaeology. The Archaeology track within the Anthropology major provides students with a broad education in the methods and theories of archaeology, as well as a foundation in anthropological and archaeological concepts, methods, and theories. Students take courses that cover a wide range of topics, from the earliest human history to complex societies, and gain hands-on experience through field and laboratory research.
name: Archaeology (B.A.)

description: The Department of Art and Art History offers undergraduate and graduate degrees in the study of the history of art. The undergraduate major in Art History is designed to provide students with a broad understanding of the history of art from a variety of cultures and historical periods. Students develop critical thinking, research, and writing skills through the study of art historical methods, theories, and practices.
name: Art History (B.A.)

description: The Art Practice major is designed to give students a broad foundation in the studio arts. Students explore a range of media and deepen their understanding of contemporary art practices. They are introduced to diverse approaches to making, thinking, and writing about art, as well as to critical issues in contemporary culture. Students are encouraged to take risks and experiment with different media and techniques. The major provides a rich and varied curriculum that prepares students for a range of careers in the arts, from studio practice to art history, criticism, and arts administration.
name: Art Practice (B.A.)

description: The Department of Asian American Studies offers an undergraduate major and minor in Asian American Studies. The program provides students a comprehensive education in Asian American Studies, with coursework on the history, culture, and experiences of Asian Americans. Students develop an understanding of the complex and diverse experiences of Asian Americans, as well as the ability to think critically about the intersections of race, ethnicity, gender, class, and sexuality.
name: Asian American Studies (B.A.)

description: The Bioengineering undergraduate major provides a broad foundation in the engineering and biological sciences, preparing students for a wide range of career opportunities in medicine, research, industry, and government. The program emphasizes the development of skills in problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication, as well as the ability to work effectively in interdisciplinary teams.
name: Bioengineering (B.S.)

description: The Department of Biology offers a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology, which provides a foundation in the principles of biology and prepares students for a wide range of careers in the life sciences. The program includes coursework in genetics, biochemistry, molecular biology, ecology, evolution, and more.
name: Biology (B.S.)

description: The undergraduate program in Chemical Engineering provides a foundation in the principles of chemical engineering, including transport processes, thermodynamics, and reaction kinetics. Students learn to apply mathematical and scientific principles to analyze and design chemical processes and systems. The program includes coursework in mathematics, physics, chemistry, and biology, as well as core chemical engineering courses and electives.
name: Chemical Engineering (B.S.)

description: The Chemistry B.S. program is designed to provide a deep understanding of the principles of chemistry, including the ability to apply chemical principles to solve problems. The program includes coursework in inorganic, organic, physical, and analytical chemistry, as well as laboratory research experience. Students are prepared for careers in research, industry, and education, as well as for graduate study in chemistry or related fields.
name: Chemistry (B.S.)

description: The Department of Chicana/o - Latina/o Studies offers an undergraduate major that provides students with a deep understanding of the histories, cultures, and experiences of Chicanas/os and Latinas/os in the United States. The program is interdisciplinary, drawing on fields such as history, sociology, literature, and cultural studies. Students explore the complex social, economic, and political contexts that have shaped the lives of Chicanas/os and Latinas/os, and they develop critical thinking, research, and analytical skills.
name: Chicana/o - Latina/o Studies (B.A.)

description: The Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering offers a Bachelor of Science degree in Civil Engineering. The program's mission is to educate students to be leaders in the design, construction, operation, and maintenance of infrastructure systems. The curriculum provides a broad foundation in the fundamental principles of civil engineering, including structural analysis and design, transportation systems, water resources engineering, geotechnical engineering, and environmental engineering. Students can choose from a range of technical electives to develop depth in a particular area. The program aims to produce graduates with a strong foundation in engineering principles, problem-solving skills, and the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively.
name: Civil Engineering (B.S.)

description: The Department of Classics at Stanford offers a comprehensive program in Classics, leading to a Bachelor of Arts degree. The program is designed to provide students with a strong foundation in the languages, literature, and cultures of ancient Greece and Rome, as well as to introduce them to the methods and approaches of classical scholarship. Students have the opportunity to explore a wide range of topics, from the textual analysis of ancient authors to the study of ancient history, archaeology, and art history.
name: Classics (B.A.)

description: The Department of Communication at Stanford University offers an undergraduate major in Communication that provides students with a broad understanding of the field and its connections to other disciplines. The major is designed for students who wish to explore the ways in which communication shapes and is shaped by social, cultural, and political contexts. Students in the major choose from a range of courses that cover topics such as media studies, interpersonal communication, persuasion, and public discourse. The major prepares students for a variety of careers in fields such as media, public relations, advertising, and education, as well as for graduate study in Communication and related fields.
name: Communication (B.A.)

description: The Department of Comparative Literature offers an undergraduate major that introduces students to the study of literature across linguistic and cultural boundaries. The curriculum includes a range of courses that explore literary traditions in a global context, examining the historical, cultural, and theoretical contexts of literary production. Students develop critical thinking, close reading, and analytical writing skills through the study of diverse literary texts and traditions.
name: Comparative Literature (B.A.)

description: The Comparative Studies in Race and Ethnicity major is an interdisciplinary program that examines the complex ways in which race and ethnicity shape individual and group experiences within historical and contemporary contexts. The program draws on a range of disciplines, including sociology, history, literature, and cultural studies, to provide students with a nuanced understanding of the ways in which race and ethnicity are constructed and deployed. Students develop critical thinking, research, and analytical skills through coursework and a senior research seminar.
name: Comparative Studies in Race and Ethnicity (B.A.)

description: The undergraduate program in Computer Science aims to develop students' breadth of knowledge across the subject areas of computer science, including their ability to apply the defining processes of computer science theory, abstraction, design, and implementation to solve problems in the discipline. Students take core courses in programming techniques, mathematical foundations, systems programming, computer architecture, analysis of algorithms, artificial intelligence, and applications. The program prepares students for careers in government, law, corporate sector, and for graduate study.
name: Computer Science (B.S.)

description: The Data Science major is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the methods and systems for acquiring, processing, and analyzing data. The program emphasizes the development of skills in data analysis, machine learning, and data visualization, as well as an understanding of the social and ethical implications of data science. Students in the program take courses in data science, computer science, statistics, and mathematics, and have the opportunity to pursue a range of electives and specializations.
name: Data Science (B.A.)

description: The Bachelor of Science in Data Science program at Stanford University is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the data science process, from data acquisition and cleaning to machine learning and statistical modeling. The program focuses on developing skills in programming, data analysis, and visualization, as well as understanding the ethical and societal implications of data science. Students learn through a combination of coursework, hands-on projects, and electives that allow them to tailor their education to their interests.
name: Data Science (B.S.)

description: The undergraduate major in Design is offered by the Department of Mechanical Engineering. The program provides a broad foundation in the principles, theory, and practice of design, as well as a strong background in engineering fundamentals, mathematics, and science. Students develop skills in design thinking, creative problem-solving, and communication, preparing them for careers in product design, service design, and design research, as well as for graduate study.
name: Design (B.S.)

description: The Earth and Planetary Sciences major provides a comprehensive understanding of the Earth and planetary systems, encompassing the study of the Earth's physical structure, processes, and history, as well as the interactions between the Earth's lithosphere, hydrosphere, atmosphere, and biosphere. Students explore a range of topics, from the Earth's internal dynamics and surface processes to the Earth's climate system and the impact of human activities on the environment.
name: Earth and Planetary Sciences (B.S.)
college: School of Earth, Energy & Environmental Sciences

description: The Earth Systems Program is an interdisciplinary major that examines the Earth as a complex, interconnected system. Students explore the Earth's physical, biological, and social processes and how they interact and influence one another. The program provides a broad foundation in Earth sciences, including coursework in geological sciences, ecology, biology, and environmental studies. Students also develop skills in data analysis, modeling, and problem-solving.
name: Earth Systems (B.S.)
college: School of Earth, Energy & Environmental Sciences

description: The Department of East Asian Languages and Cultures offers an undergraduate major in East Asian Studies leading to the Bachelor of Arts degree. The major is designed for students who wish to develop an understanding of East Asia from an interdisciplinary perspective. Students are expected to acquire a broad knowledge of East Asia, including its history, cultures, and languages, as well as to develop a deeper understanding of a particular discipline or area of concentration.
name: East Asian Studies (B.A.)

description: The Department of Economics offers an undergraduate major in Economics leading to a Bachelor of Arts degree. The major provides students with a broad understanding of economic theory, econometrics, and applied economics, and prepares students for careers in a variety of fields, including government, finance, and research.
name: Economics (B.A.)

description: The undergraduate major in Economics is designed to provide students with a fundamental understanding of economic theory, its application, and its empirical underpinnings. The program includes coursework in microeconomics, macroeconomics, econometrics, and various elective fields. Students develop skills in critical thinking, data analysis, and written and oral communication.
name: Economics (B.S.)

description: The Electrical Engineering program is designed to provide students with a broad foundation in the principles and practices of electrical engineering, including the analysis and design of electrical systems, electronics, and electromagnetism. The curriculum includes core courses in circuits, electronics, digital systems, and electromagnetic fields, as well as electives in areas such as computer engineering, control systems, and power electronics. Students are also required to complete a senior project and meet the university's general education requirements.
name: Electrical Engineering (B.S.)

description: The undergraduate major in Energy Science and Engineering (ENERGY) is an interdisciplinary program that focuses on the scientific and engineering principles underlying energy production, conversion, transmission, and use. Students explore energy-related topics across multiple disciplines and acquire a foundation to develop effective solutions to contemporary energy challenges.
name: Energy Science and Engineering (B.S.)
college: School of Earth, Energy & Environmental Sciences

description: The Bachelor of Science in Engineering degree is offered by the School of Engineering. Students select one of the following engineering disciplines: bioengineering, chemical engineering, civil engineering, electrical engineering, or mechanical engineering. The program requires a minimum of 180 units, with at least 96 units in engineering and related subjects. Students must also complete a set of required courses, including mathematics, physics, and chemistry.
name: Engineering (B.S.)

description: The Department of English offers a program of study leading to a Bachelor of Arts degree in English. The undergraduate major is designed to give students a broad understanding of English literature, including the historical development of the language, literary genres, and major authors. Students develop skills in close reading, critical thinking, and written and oral communication.
name: English (B.A.)

description: The Environmental Systems Engineering (ENVSE) undergraduate major provides a foundation in the engineering sciences and earth systems to understand and manage complex environmental systems. The program focuses on developing skills in problem-solving, data analysis, and technology applications, preparing students for careers in engineering, research, policy, and management related to environmental challenges.
name: Environmental Systems Engineering (B.S.)

description: The Feminist, Gender, and Sexuality Studies (FGSS) major at Stanford University is an interdisciplinary program that examines the intersections of gender, sexuality, race, class, and nation. The major provides a rigorous foundation in feminist and queer theories, and prepares students to analyze and critique the complex relationships between power, identity, and culture. Students explore the ways in which gender and sexuality shape and are shaped by social, cultural, and political contexts, and develop a nuanced understanding of the intersections and divergences between different forms of inequality.
name: Feminist, Gender, and Sexuality Studies (B.A.)

description: The Film and Media Studies program provides students with a broad understanding of the historical, theoretical, and cultural significance of film and media. Students explore the development of cinema and media in relation to social, cultural, and technological contexts, analyzing the ways in which media shape our understanding of the world. Through a range of courses, students develop critical thinking, writing, and analytical skills, preparing them for a variety of careers or further study.
name: Film and Media Studies (B.A.)

description: The French major is designed to develop the student's language proficiency and cultural awareness. Students take courses that cover French literature, culture, history, and language. The major is designed to be flexible, allowing students to pursue their interests and career goals.
name: French (B.A.)

description: The Geophysics major is designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of the Earth's internal and external processes. Students learn about the Earth's structure, composition, and evolution, as well as the physical processes that shape our planet. The program combines coursework in geophysics, geology, physics, mathematics, and computer science to prepare students for careers in research, industry, and academia.
name: Geophysics (B.S.)
college: School of Earth, Energy & Environmental Sciences

description: The Department of German Studies at Stanford University offers a program leading to the Bachelor of Arts in German Studies. Students may pursue a major in German Studies by completing a program of study that includes coursework in German language, literature, and culture, as well as courses that focus on the historical and cultural contexts of the German-speaking world. The major is designed to provide students with a deep understanding of the German language and culture, as well as the skills to analyze and interpret complex texts and cultural artifacts.
name: German Studies (B.A.)

description: The Department of History offers an undergraduate major in History leading to a Bachelor of Arts degree. The History major is designed to give students a broad understanding of the world's past and to develop critical skills in reading, writing, and research. Students work closely with advisors to select a program of study that fits their interests and goals, choosing from a wide range of courses that cover different periods, regions, and themes.
name: History (B.A.)

description: The Human Biology major is an undergraduate program that provides a broad and integrative view of human health, incorporating perspectives from biology, psychology, anthropology, and sociology. The major is designed for students who wish to understand the complex factors influencing human health and well-being. It covers a range of topics, from molecular and cellular biology to social and cultural contexts of health.
name: Human Biology (B.A.)

description: The Human Biology Major is an interdisciplinary program that focuses on the study of human health, the factors that influence health, and the ways that health can be improved. It allows students to explore the biology of human health and disease, the impact of social and environmental factors on health, and the development of interventions to promote health.
name: Human Biology (B.S.)

description: The Department of Iberian and Latin American Cultures (ILAC) offers an undergraduate major that explores the cultures of the Iberian Peninsula and Latin America from the Middle Ages to the present, focusing on the historical, social, and cultural contexts that have shaped these regions. Students engage with a diverse range of materials, including literature, film, and visual arts, and have the opportunity to develop proficiency in Spanish, Portuguese, or other relevant languages. The major is designed to foster critical thinking, cultural competence, and a nuanced understanding of the complex historical and contemporary dynamics at play in these regions.
name: Iberian and Latin American Cultures (B.A.)

description: The Individually Designed Major in Engineering is a flexible program that enables undergraduates to propose, design, and complete an interdisciplinary engineering curriculum tailored to their individual interests and career goals. Students work with a faculty adviser to define a coherent program that combines courses from multiple engineering disciplines and related fields, such as the natural sciences, mathematics, and computer science. The program is ideal for students whose interests span traditional departmental boundaries or who wish to integrate engineering with other disciplines.
name: Individually Designed Major in Engineering (B.S.)

description: The undergraduate major in International Relations is an interdisciplinary program that provides students with a comprehensive understanding of global issues, international politics, and the complex interactions between states, international organizations, and non-state actors. The program draws on coursework from several departments, including Political Science, Economics, History, and Languages, to equip students with the analytical tools and knowledge necessary to navigate the complexities of global affairs.
name: International Relations (B.A.)

description: The Department of Italian offers a program leading to the Bachelor of Arts in Italian. The program is designed to develop students' linguistic and cultural proficiency through the study of Italian language, literature, and culture. Students acquire a deep understanding of Italian literary and cultural traditions, as well as the skills to analyze and interpret literary and cultural texts.
name: Italian (B.A.)

description: The Jewish Studies program is an interdisciplinary field that explores the diverse cultural, historical, religious, and literary traditions associated with Jewish identity and communities. Students engage with a range of topics, from biblical and rabbinic texts to modern Jewish history, literature, and culture. Through coursework and research, students develop a nuanced understanding of Jewish experiences, analyzing the complexities and richness of Jewish heritage within various global contexts.
name: Jewish Studies (B.A.)

description: The Department of Linguistics at Stanford University offers an undergraduate major in Linguistics leading to the Bachelor of Arts degree. The major is designed to provide students with a broad understanding of the fundamental principles and methods of linguistic analysis, as well as the opportunity to explore the diversity of linguistic structures and the ways in which they are acquired, processed, and used in human communication. Students learn about the sound systems, grammatical structures, and meaning of languages, as well as the social and cognitive contexts in which language is used.
name: Linguistics (B.A.)

description: The undergraduate major in Management Science and Engineering (MS&E) provides students with an understanding of how individuals, organizations, and societies make decisions, and the means to analyze and improve the decision-making process. The program is designed to give students a broad understanding of the field, as well as the ability to apply analytical and computational techniques to real-world problems.
name: Management Science and Engineering (B.S.)

description: The undergraduate major in Materials Science and Engineering (MSE) at Stanford provides a broad foundation in the properties and applications of materials, with a strong emphasis on the underlying science and engineering principles. The program is designed to be flexible, allowing students to balance depth in their chosen field with exploration of related areas. Students engage with core coursework in materials properties, processing, and characterization, as well as advanced electives and laboratory experiences, culminating in a comprehensive understanding of materials science and its applications.
name: Materials Science and Engineering (B.S.)

description: The Mathematics major is designed to provide a broad foundation in the major areas of mathematics and to develop students' ability to critically analyze and solve problems using mathematical reasoning. The program includes a range of courses in pure and applied mathematics, as well as the opportunity to explore advanced topics through electives.
name: Mathematics (B.S.)

description: The Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering program at Stanford University aims to develop a broad foundation in mechanical engineering principles, as well as the skills to apply these principles to real-world problems. The program covers topics such as mechanics, thermodynamics, materials science, and mechanical design, providing a strong grounding for a variety of careers or further study.
name: Mechanical Engineering (B.S.)

description: The Department of Music offers an undergraduate major leading to a Bachelor of Arts degree in Music. The program provides a comprehensive education in music theory, history, and performance, and is designed to be flexible enough to accommodate students with diverse musical backgrounds and interests. Students are encouraged to explore the full range of musical styles and genres, from classical to jazz and beyond.
name: Music (B.A.)

description: The Department of Native American Studies offers an undergraduate major in Native American Studies leading to the Bachelor of Arts degree. The program is designed to provide students the opportunity to explore the histories, cultures, and contemporary experiences of Native peoples throughout the Western Hemisphere, with a particular emphasis on Native North America. Students explore the history of Native American cultural and political interactions with non-Native peoples from the time of first contact to the present. The major is interdisciplinary, drawing on the fields of history, anthropology, literature, religious studies, law, politics, sociology, and cultural studies. Students are trained in the methodologies and epistemologies of multiple disciplines to examine the experiences of Native peoples. The major is designed for students who wish to understand the complex and diverse histories and cultures of Native communities, as well as for those who plan to pursue careers in areas such as education, law, healthcare, and public policy.
name: Native American Studies (B.A.)

description: The Department of Philosophy offers a program leading to the Bachelor of Arts degree. Students undertaking the Philosophy major develop skills in understanding and interpreting philosophical texts, constructing and evaluating philosophical arguments, and writing clear and effective prose. Majors are encouraged to explore a wide variety of philosophical subfields and traditions.
name: Philosophy (B.A.)

description: The Philosophy and Religious Studies major is designed for students who want to explore fundamental questions about existence, values, and meaning, and understand the diverse ways that cultures and individuals have addressed these questions. Students have the opportunity to study a wide range of philosophical and religious traditions, texts, and topics, and to develop their skills in critical thinking, argumentation, and expression.
name: Philosophy and Religious Studies (B.A.)

description: The Bachelor of Science in Physics is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the fundamental principles and laws that govern the behavior of the physical universe. The program includes coursework in classical mechanics, electromagnetism, quantum mechanics, statistical mechanics, and thermodynamics, as well as laboratory and computational physics. Students are encouraged to engage in research and explore topics of interest through electives and advanced coursework.
name: Physics (B.S.)

description: The Department of Political Science offers an undergraduate major in Political Science designed to introduce students to the broad subfields that comprise the discipline: American Politics, Comparative Politics, International Relations, and Political Theory. The major is structured to allow students to explore these subfields while developing a deep understanding of the methods and theories that underpin the study of politics. Students are encouraged to pursue their interests through coursework and research opportunities.
name: Political Science (B.A.)

description: The Department of Psychology offers a Bachelor of Arts degree in Psychology. The undergraduate major in Psychology provides students with a broad background in the field, including exposure to the subfields of developmental, social, personality, cognitive, and clinical psychology. Coursework includes study of the biological bases of behavior, research methods, and statistical analysis. The major is designed to provide a general foundation in Psychology while also allowing students to explore areas of interest in depth.
name: Psychology (B.A.)

description: The Public Policy Program is an interdisciplinary major that introduces students to the methods and substance of public policy. It draws on insights and approaches from economics, political science, history, sociology, law, and philosophy to study policy issues and processes, providing students with a comprehensive understanding of the policy-making process and the impact of policy on society.
name: Public Policy (B.A.)

description: The Religious Studies major is an interdisciplinary exploration of religion and its role in human history. Majors examine the cultural, social, philosophical, and artistic dimensions of religious traditions, with a focus on primary texts, historical contexts, and comparative methods. The program is designed to foster critical thinking, cultural understanding, and nuanced analysis of complex religious phenomena. Students may choose from a variety of courses that span multiple religious traditions and historical periods.
name: Religious Studies (B.A.)

description: The Science, Technology, and Society (STS) major is an interdisciplinary program that studies the social, political, and cultural dimensions of science and technology. STS students examine the historical, philosophical, and sociological contexts of scientific and technological developments and their impacts on society. The major prepares students for a wide range of careers and graduate study in fields such as science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM), social sciences, humanities, and law.
name: Science, Technology, and Society (B.A.)

description: The Science, Technology, and Society (STS) major provides students with a foundation for understanding the complex interactions between science, technology, and society. STS approaches these interactions from a variety of disciplinary perspectives, integrating insights from the humanities, social sciences, and natural sciences. The STS major is designed for students who seek to understand the roles and responsibilities of scientists, engineers, and other technical professionals in society, and to explore the social and cultural contexts in which science and technology are developed and used.
name: Science, Technology, and Society (B.S.)

description: The Department of Slavic Languages and Literatures offers a major in Slavic Languages and Literatures leading to a Bachelor of Arts degree. The major is designed to provide students with a broad understanding of the cultures of the Slavic world, including literature, history, and culture. Students develop proficiency in a Slavic language and explore the rich literary and cultural heritage of the region.
name: Slavic Languages and Literatures (B.A.)

description: The Sociology major provides a framework for analyzing social structures, institutions, and relationships. Students examine how social forces shape individual and group outcomes, and how individuals and groups, in turn, influence social structures. The major prepares students for careers in fields such as research, policy, education, law, business, and non-profit organizations, as well as for graduate study in sociology and related fields.
name: Sociology (B.A.)

description: The Department of Spanish and Portuguese offers a program leading to the Bachelor of Arts in Spanish. The major is designed to develop students' proficiency in the Spanish language and to introduce them to the literatures and cultures of Spain and Spanish America through the study of cultural and literary texts and of other cultural artifacts.
name: Spanish (B.A.)

description: The Symbolic Systems major is an interdisciplinary program that integrates aspects of philosophy, psychology, linguistics, computer science, and cognitive science to study the nature of intelligence, representation, and meaning. The program provides a broad foundation in the core disciplines, combined with advanced coursework in areas like artificial intelligence, cognitive science, and computational linguistics.
name: Symbolic Systems (B.S.)

description: The Department of Theater and Performance Studies offers an undergraduate major in Theater and Performance Studies leading to a Bachelor of Arts degree. The program combines a liberal arts education with an intensive, practical, performance-based curriculum. Students participate in a range of performance activities, including acting, directing, playwriting, and design. The curriculum also includes coursework in theater history, dramatic theory, and performance studies.
name: Theater and Performance Studies (B.A.)

description: The Department of Urban Studies offers an undergraduate major in Urban Studies that provides students with a comprehensive understanding of the complex issues surrounding urban development, social inequality, and environmental sustainability. The program draws on a range of disciplines, including sociology, economics, politics, and environmental studies, to provide students with a nuanced understanding of the urban condition. Students have the opportunity to engage in research, internships, and community-based projects, preparing them for careers in fields such as urban planning, policy, and advocacy.
name: Urban Studies (B.A.)
